title: What This Course Is About
purpose: Understand the course goal: short lessons with a quiz to help learning.
study: Welcome! This is a short guide to Christianity for beginners.
We do not try to make you join anything.
We help you understand so you can decide.
Each unit has short study, verses, and a quiz.
We use plain, everyday language.
Quizzes help you think and learn. Questions are normal.

verses.text: For God loved the world so much that he gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not be lost but have eternal life.
Ask, and you will receive. Seek, and you will find. Knock, and the door will be opened to you.

quiz.q: This course wants to force you to join a church.
quiz.explanation: False. The course aims to explain Christianity so you can decide for yourself.

quiz.q: How long should a unit take?
quiz.explanation: Units are short and focused so you can learn a bit at a time.

quiz.q: The quizzes are meant to shame you.
quiz.explanation: False. Quizzes help you remember and learn.

quiz.q: What will each unit include?
options: Short study, 1-2 verses, and a short quiz
quiz.explanation: That is the simple, consistent format.

quiz.q: If you do not understand a term, what should you expect?
options: The course will explain it simply
You will be left to look it up
The course will avoid every important term
quiz.explanation: The tone is friendly and clarifies church words when needed.

title: Who Is God? (Overview)
purpose: A plain summary of God from a Christian view.
study: Christians say God made and keeps everything.
Many say God is loving, fair, and near.
God is not distant. God cares about people.
Different churches say different things about God.
Questions about God are normal.
We use clear examples so you form your own view.

verses.text: The Lord is good. His love lasts forever, and he is faithful to all who trust him.

quiz.q: Christians describe God as a caring creator.
quiz.explanation: True — Christians often speak of God as loving and creating the world.

quiz.q: Which is a common word used about God?
quiz.explanation: Creator is a common word to describe God.

quiz.q: God is always distant and not involved with people.
quiz.explanation: False — many Christians believe God is present and cares for people.

quiz.q: If you have questions about God, you should:
quiz.explanation: Exploring questions honestly is helpful.

quiz.q: Different Christian groups might emphasize different things about God.
quiz.explanation: True — traditions can stress different aspects of God.

title: Who Is Jesus? (Overview)
purpose: A simple explanation of Jesus and why Christians focus on him.
study: Jesus is the main figure in Christianity.
Christians say Jesus taught about God and showed God's love.
Christians say Jesus died and came back to life. This gives hope.
Learning about Jesus helps explain what Christians believe.
We explain Jesus in simple, everyday words.
Questions are welcome. You do not have to decide anything.

verses.text: I am the resurrection and the life. Anyone who believes in me will live, even after dying.

quiz.q: Who is central to Christianity?
quiz.explanation: Jesus is central to Christianity.

quiz.q: Christians believe Jesus showed God's love.
quiz.explanation: True — many Christians see Jesus as showing God's love in actions and teaching.

quiz.q: Understanding Jesus is only for experts.
quiz.explanation: False — this course explains Jesus simply for anyone.

quiz.q: Which is often connected to Jesus' life?
quiz.explanation: Jesus is often connected with teaching and helping others.

quiz.q: You must accept all church ideas to study Jesus.
quiz.explanation: False — you can learn and form your own view without pressure.

title: What Is the Bible? (How to Read It)
purpose: Give simple tools for reading the Bible as a beginner.
study: The Bible is a collection of many books: stories, letters, and songs.
Read a short passage slowly and ask what it says and what it might mean for you.
Use a simple translation and a few short notes to help with hard words.

verses.text: All Scripture is inspired by God and is useful for teaching and training in right living.

quiz.q: The Bible is:
options: A library of different kinds of writing
quiz.explanation: It includes stories, poems, letters, and more.

quiz.q: Reading a short passage slowly can help you understand it.
quiz.explanation: True — slow, careful reading helps.

quiz.q: A helpful question to ask when reading:
quiz.explanation: Asking the historical and personal meaning helps understanding.

quiz.q: You need to memorize the whole Bible to begin studying it.
quiz.explanation: False — start small and grow your reading over time.

quiz.q: Different parts of the Bible can be different kinds of writing.
quiz.explanation: True — stories, poetry, letters, and more.

title: What Christians Mean by Sin
purpose: Explain sin simply: what it is and why it matters.
study: Sin means choosing to do things that hurt others or break how life should work.
It can be big choices or small habits that harm trust or relationships.
Recognizing harm is the first step to change and healing.
Many faith practices focus on honesty, repair, and doing better.
The point is not shame, but naming what needs to be fixed.
We will cover forgiveness and steps to make things right.

verses.text: For everyone has sinned; we all fall short of God's glorious standard.

quiz.q: Sin only means big crimes.
quiz.explanation: False — it can be small repeated hurts as well as big wrongs.

quiz.q: Recognizing harmful choices is:
quiz.explanation: Naming what is wrong can lead to repair.

quiz.q: Christian practice often includes trying to repair harm.
quiz.explanation: True — forgiveness and repair are common themes.

quiz.q: Sin affects:
quiz.explanation: It often affects relationships and trust.

quiz.q: The course shames you for doubts.
quiz.explanation: False — the tone is honest and non-judgmental.

title: Grace and Forgiveness
purpose: Explain grace simply and how forgiveness works in Christian thought.
study: Grace means getting help or kindness you do not earn. It is core to Christianity.
Forgiveness means letting go of anger and working to repair harm.
Christians see God's grace as a fresh start, not being stuck in past mistakes.
Forgiveness can mean: say sorry, change, and build trust again.
Grace may not remove all consequences. But it offers hope.
Look at real examples of giving and getting forgiveness.

verses.text: God saved you by his grace when you believed. And you cannot take credit for this; it is a gift from God.

quiz.q: Grace means getting kindness you do not deserve.
quiz.explanation: True — grace is often described this way.

quiz.q: Forgiveness often includes:
options: Making everything pretend to be okay
quiz.explanation: Repair and trust-building are practical parts of forgiveness.

quiz.q: Grace removes all consequences automatically.
quiz.explanation: False — there may still be consequences, but grace opens a path forward.

quiz.q: Which is a helpful step in forgiving?
quiz.explanation: Apology and changed behavior help healing.

quiz.q: Grace is a hopeful idea in Christianity.
quiz.explanation: True — grace points to hope and new starts.
